author: Björn Ritzl
description: Lua modules and scripts to simplify input related operations such as gestures detection, user configurable key bindings, input state handling and dragging/clicking game objects.
name: Defold-Input

releases.message: NEW: The gesture module will report swipe events as soon as they are detected and not only after release. To differentiate between an ongoing swipe and a released swipe there is now also a boolean flag `swipe_released` and `two_finger_swipe_released` to indicate if the swipe happened before or when released.
FIX: Pinch state was not accurately calculated sometimes
FIX: Cursor string URLs were not working as intended.
CHANGE: The `onscreen.lua` module will now handle switch to multitouch mode on iOS. Thanks @aglitchman !
NEW: The gesture module will now report `repeated` on touch events. Thanks @Jerakin!

NEW: Added `cursor.reset(url)` to reset the state of a cursor. Useful when a window focus lost or minimize event happens and you want to clear the state of the cursor.
FIX: There is no longer a requirement that `cursor.init()` has been called before `cursor.listener()`
NEW: Programatically start a cursor drag operation (info: https://github.com/britzl/defold-input/blob/master/in/cursor.md#drag-objects)

NEW: Added `origin_x` and `origin_y` to drag event to give position of mouse/touch down
NEW: Added `drag_event_only` option to cursor to only send the drag event but not start dragging the object under the cursor

Thanks to @Trevortni for the contributions!
FIX: Clear drag state on release if drag was cancelled. Thanks @Trevortni
FIX: Don't ignore a potential drag (press+move) just because the cursor moved outside of the object but hasn't yet reached the drag threshold.
FIX: Cancelled drag events prevented further drag events
FIX: Don't try to drag an object more than once in a single pressed/released cycle if the drag was cancelled by the user
NEW: Added option to lock drag operations to a single axis.

BREAKING CHANGE: Removed all.iniput_bindings. The same file exists in the Defold builtins now.
BREAKING CHANGE: Removed the gamepads file. The one in Defold builtins contains many more gamepads than the one included in this project.

NEW: The cursor will generate cursor.CLICKED when clicking outside of a game object (id and group are nil)
NEW: Cursor will generate cursor.DRAG while dragging. The event has a `dx` and `dy` with delta values from the initial drag position.
NEW: Cursor will generate cursor.DRAG_START and cursor.DRAG_END when dragging outside of a game object (id and group are nil)
NEW: Analog directional events are generated while above the threshold
NEW: Analog input can generate directional (cardinal) events when stick is moved beyond a specified threshold
FIX: Tweaked analog stick messages
FIX: Clear analog control position after notifying listener of release event
NEW: Added reusable onscreen.gui_script to manage on screen controls
FIX: Issue with missing cursor out event when drag is disabled
FIX: Issue with the cursor if the thing it was over was deleted by a PRESSED or OVER event
FIX: Missing default value for multi-touch in the gesture detector
FIX: Multi-touch issue for onscreen.lua
FIX: 2.8.1 was broken due to search and replace error
FIX: Minor tweak to returned data from onscreen controls

NEW: onscreen.lua now returns more information about the node that was pressed
NEW: onscreen.BUTTON and onscreen.ANALOG callbacks are now generated for every button or analog interaction 

See readme and the included example for more info about the changes.
FIX: Multi-touch didn't correctly match touch points in the onscreen.lua module
FIX: Cleanup when generating cursor events

NEW: Added cursor event overrider and listener mechanic via `cursor.listen(cursor_script_url, cursor_event, callback)`
NEW Added cursor clicked event (`cursor.CLICKED`)
FIX: Cursor over/out events are now generated while dragging
NEW: Added collision object filter to the cursor script
NEW: Added onscreen.reset() to allow users of the singleton version of the module to clean up old bindings, for instance when loading and unloading GUI components.
FIX: Deleting an object while it was being dragged resulted in an error
CHANGE: Dragged objects keep their z value at all times. This gives the developer full control of the z value while dragging an object.
FIX: Fixed issue with game object delete detection in cursor.script
NEW: The mapper module can now filter on gamepad index when binding an input trigger to an action

NEW: Alternative way of using instances of state, onscreen and accelerometer:

```
local state = require "in.state"

function init(self)
    self.instance = state.create()
end

function on_input(self, action_id, action)
    self.instance.on_input(action_id, action)
    -- new alternative way
    state.on_input(action_id, action, self.instance)
end
```
NEW: Added mapper.unbind_all([player])
NEW: First version of onscreen.lua for working with virtual on-screen controls

BREAKING CHANGE: The trigger constants in mapper.lua has been moved to the new triggers.lua module.
NEW: triggers.lua contains all input event triggers from all.input_bindings together with functions to check if a trigger is a mouse, keyboard or gamepad event.
NEW: Added constants for the gamepad connect/disconnect bindings
NEW: gamepad_connected and gamepad_disconnected bindings added

NEW: Added cursor constants to Lua module in.cursor
FIX: Better detection of deleted game object before sending cursor events
NEW: The cursor.script will now also generate pressed and release events when pressing outside of a game object
FIX: Improved mouse vs touch control of the cursor
FIX: Improved cursor support on mobile/touch
NEW: button.lua will assign an auto-generated node id if the node doesn't have an id (empty hash). This is typically encountered in cloned nodes.

FIX: Unregistering nodes using a string didn't work
CHANGE: Button clicks are now required to have both pressed and released inside the button to be treated as a click
FIX: Unregistering a button didn't work. Thanks @Jerakin
